data.event: This was later published as Death Of An Irish Town, and later republished as No One Shouted Stop! Written in 1967, it was highly critical of government policies towards rural areas, and took Charlestown as an example solely because it was the town of the author's birth.

event.title: reached the All-Ireland club semi-final in 2001

data.event: Gaelic Football team Charlestown Sarsfields reached the All-Ireland club semi-final in 2001, losing out on a final spot by two points.

event.title: 2012 the town's sporting offering was complemented

data.event: In 2012 the town's sporting offering was complemented with the formation of Charlestown Boxing Club.
